publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1656.1 Bristow Muldoon: Centralisation of Health Services in Scotland—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1656) in the name of Dr Jean Turner, insert at end "and calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to issue instructions to NHS boards to put in place appropriate arrangements to retain services faced with centralisation and reinstate any that have been withdrawn without full public consultation and ministerial approval."
S2M-1656.1 Centralisation of Health Services in Scotland (lodged on 20 September 2004) Colin Fox*, Margaret Jamieson*
S2M-1656.1 Centralisation of Health Services in Scotland (lodged on 20 September 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S2M-1656.1 Bristow Muldoon: Centralisation of Health Services in Scotland—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1656) in the name of Dr Jean Turner, insert at end "and calls upon the Minister for Health and Community Care to issue instructions to NHS boards to put in place appropriate arrangements to retain services faced with centralisation and reinstate any that have been withdrawn without full public consultation and ministerial approval." Supported by: Colin Fox, Margaret Jamieson, Mr Kenny MacAskill
S2M-1656.1 Centralisation of Health Services in Scotland (lodged on 20 September 2004) Carolyn Leckie*
